body.name: BabyBackups Diaper Extender Pads, Prevent Diaper Blowouts, 25 Pack
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 14 hrs 23 mins
features: They are disposable pads that fit and secure into any brand of disposable diaper
The pads are hypoallergenic and extremely soft, 25 come in a box
Unlike other products, these pads completely contain the mess within the diaper
Use them at home or on the go, either way, feel confident that you will experience a blowout-free day

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: BabyBackups Diaper Extender Pads Stop Up-The-Back Blowouts, Period! Anyone who has experienced a diaper blowout knows how awful it is to deal with, especially if it happens in the car or a public place. Cleanup may be as simple as changing your precious little one's diaper and clothes, or as extensive as buying a new outfit and steam cleaning everything around the epicenter of the incident. Either way, it's unpleasant and something that should be avoided if at all possible. BabyBackups are the best solution for keeping your #1 priority's "number two" exactly where it should be. While other products trap the mess between the baby's skin and the product, BabyBackups eliminate messy cleanups and embarrassing situations by keeping liquid where it belongs, in the diaper. Whether at home or on the go, protect against diaper blowouts with BabyBackups.

What are BabyBackups? BabyBackups are a disposable diaper extender pad. Made of super-absorbent materials, the hypoallergenic wedge-shaped pad fits securely between the waistband of a diaper and the baby’s back, containing the dreaded blowout by keeping the mess right in your baby's diaper. They come in one size and are meant to be used for infants in diapers size 0 through 5.

How do I use BabyBackups? Because BabyBackups completely contain poop explosions, using them makes clean up a breeze. Instead of hosing down your little angel in the nearest bathroom, simply swap out that messy diaper for a fresh, clean one. But don’t forget to secure a new disposable BabyBackups. BabyBackups can be securely attached to any brand of diaper by simply removing the protective backing and pressing the product, adhesive side first, securely to the diaper. BabyBackups even include a blue alignment line to help ensure they are placed quickly and effectively each and every time. We made BabyBackups so easy to use that there's no reason to ever experience a diaper blowout again!

When should I use BabyBackups? When is the best time to use BabyBackups? Whenever you need peace of mind. Maybe when you're taking a flight to see some friends and don't want to have to deal with a messy outfit change on the plane. Or maybe for your daughter's baptism when she's wearing that beautiful white dress. Or it could be on that long car ride - because cleaning a car seat isn't fun. Or it might simply be when you lay your little guy down at night so that you're not waking up to a crib full of poo (or use in the front for extra leakage protection). You barely sleep as it is, make life a little easier on yourself and use BabyBackups.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great "new Baby" gift idea, too!
reviews.reviewText: We watch our granddaughter during the week and have had our share of messy cleanups to deal with. Our daughter has tried different brands of diapers, but none of them have completely contained the mess, especially when the little girl is taking a nap. We figured we would give these BabyBackups a try, and we couldn't be happier (especially Grandma, if you know what I mean). We haven't had an incident since we started using them.I also started buying these for clients whose children became parents. Talk about a great conversation starter when your proud grandpa or grandma becomes a grandparent - especially since grandma (always) knows best! Inexpensive way to "entertain" a client, too!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars THIS REALLY IS A MUST HAVE FOR PARENTS
reviews.reviewText: This product works even better than I had hoped, and it is super easy to use. I bought it for the occasional trip to the store, hoping that it would stop any "messes" from leaking out the top of our daughter's diaper while away from the house. There were a few occasions when I heard a noise that made me think I'd be throwing the stroller away, but to my surprise/delight everything was contained. These things work so well that we use them regularly to help save an outfit change or two during the day. The pad is super easy to use, stays in place, and does what it claimed it could do--stop blowouts up the back of the diaper. Until things change in the diaper department, we'll be using these pads on a daily basis!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Better than nothing, need to use more then 1 for them to work
reviews.reviewText: These are mediocre but better than nothing. I bought them because my daughter has multiple poop blowouts a day and so I researched and bought several options to try to prevent soiling and ruining so much clothing. These pads only work for us if we use 2 or 3 at once (lined up side by side and sometimes a third above the first two, see photos).Also I noticed they only work with some diaper brands, that rise higher up the back (for us, they fail with every diaper brand we've tried except pampers pure). Even when we use 2 or 3 of these, they only stop the blowout 80% of the time.When she just pees, I can remove the pads and the adhesive will work again on another diaper or 2.Overall, less dirty/ruined laundry for me, but they should definitely be made longer and larger and with more in the box.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great for plane and car travel with baby
reviews.reviewText: Bought a package of these for a Thanksgiving journey involving plane travel and a long car ride. The pad prevented a messy back poo-splosion during an airport layover-- worth the money for that alone. Adhesive strip easily affixes pad to back of diaper. We prepped diapers with pads ahead of time, so they were ready in diaper bag when needed. An un-soiled pad can be re-used by carefully peeling it off an otherwise dirty diaper. A little expensive for everyday use, but definitely worth having along on road trips.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2022
reviews.reviewText: We bought these baby backups because our exclusively breastfed little guy was having a ton of blowouts up the back while he was in between diaper sizes. These actually work and have saved so many shirts and quite a bit of frustration! The only thing is that I wish a bit more came in the box, but you can reuse one of the backups (given it's clean) two or three times if you remove it without ripping too much diaper off with it. Now baby doesn't have quite as many blowouts at four and a half months, but they still do happen on occasion, which is where these things have been a lifesaver. I like to use these when we go on car rides, out in public, and when he is laying down for sleep overnight. I highly recommend them!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Meh. Kotex is cheaper and larger.
reviews.reviewText: These are basically cloud shaped maxi pads. The adhesive should have been done a bit more thoughtfully; they stick to the clothing as well as the diaper.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Going in a plane with a baby? GET THIS PRODUCT NOW!
reviews.reviewText: Before we flew for the first time with our twin girls, the biggest advice wa to bring an extra change of clothes for the babies and ouselves. This was often followed by the horror of an on flight blowout that was less than appealing to other passengers. I saw these and was curious so I got them on a whim. First of all, my wife is skeptical of all things with grand promises and it took some convincing her to let me use them. On our short flight from Seattle to L.A., the unspeakable happened. One of our daughters made the "super-pooh blowout face" followed by the all familiar "this will be a messy change" smell. I went to change her and expected to change out her clothes too but it was not needed. The poop traveled up her back as usual but the extra cover kept it from "over-flowing". My wife didn't believe me till she had to change our other daughter and got the same results. We now use these not only on flights, but long car trips, hiking or fancy events where the girls are in a dress... like their baptism for instance. Now it may not help for the "side blowouts" that come out the leg, but for us that only happened when we improperly put on a diaper or when the girls were starting to grow out their diaper size. Seriously, these things work and you be so thankful when you see what disasters these things avoid.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for blow outs
reviews.reviewText: It doesn’t stop all blowouts but works well to contain them and save clothes.Amazon ships them in bags and the boxes of pads are always damaged/crushed.
